Air pollution is better assessed by examining human exposure to multiple criteria pollutants or through a multi‐pollutant Air Quality Index (AQI). As compared to AQIs developed using in situ measurements of pollutants across sparse monitoring stations, satellite‐based products provide better spatiotemporal patterns. We assess the long‐term air pollution exposure in India using a Satellite‐based Multi‐pollutant Index (SMPI) using satellite derived surface PM
